definition: Buildings associated with agricultural properties for farming activities, storage, or rural residential use.

positive_examples: The old red barn stored hay and housed the dairy cows during winter.
They converted the farmhouse into a charming bed and breakfast.
The farmer parked his tractor in the garage attached to his rural home.
We toured the historic barn where they once processed maple syrup.
The farmhouse kitchen had a large window overlooking the pasture.
She stored her farming equipment in the garage next to the house.
negative_examples: The office building downtown has twenty floors of corporate suites.
Students gathered in the university library to study for exams.
The shopping mall features over a hundred retail stores.
Patients waited in the hospital emergency room lobby.
The factory produces automotive parts for major manufacturers.
Worshippers filled the church pews for Sunday morning service.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CommercialBuilding, PublicBuilding, IndustrialBuilding, ReligiousBuilding
